intro: Calycobolus africanus, commonly known as the African calycobolus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
